body_html:
This is a clear design defect in tensorflow in that tf.session objects are not fork safe, thus crippling any kind of parallelisation you might wish to do with tensorflow.

It's existed for a few years and so far each issue mentioning it has been closed with no solution. There currently exists no way around this that I or anyone else has found so far.

Yet to hear from any tensorflow contributors why exactly this is, either.

body:
This is a clear design defect in tensorflow in that tf.session objects are not fork safe, thus crippling any kind of parallelisation you might wish to do with tensorflow.

It's existed for a few years and so far each issue mentioning it has been closed with no solution. There currently exists no way around this that I or anyone else has found so far.

Yet to hear from any tensorflow contributors why exactly this is, either.
